intro: Aciotis wurdackiana, commonly known as the Wurdack's aciotis, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
